p: Compound 5e was prepared from benzo[ b]thiophene-2-carbaldehyde 4e (0.081 g, 0.5 mmol). The resulting free base was converted into salt as described below to obtained 0.120 g (62.2%) of white powder; m.p. >300 °C; 1H NMR (300 MHz, DMSO- d 6) δ 10.23 (s, 2H), 8.62 (d, J = 1.6 Hz, 1H), 8.40 (s, 1H), 8.26 (d, J = 8.6 Hz, 1H), 8.12 − 7.99 (m, 2H), 7.87 (dd, J = 1.8 Hz, J = 8.6 Hz, 1H), 7.56 − 7.44 (m, 2H), 3.52 (t, J = 5.5 Hz, 4H), 2.00 (m, 2H); 13 C NMR (75 MHz, DMSO-d 6) δ 164.8, 159.0, 155.6, 140.4, 139.3, 135.5, 134.9, 128.0, 127.1, 126.3, 125.8, 125.5, 125.3, 123.0, 122.9, 122.8, 38.9 (2 C), 17.7; Analysis calcd for C 19H 16ClN 3S 2: C, 59.13; H, 4.18; N, 10.89%; Found: C, 59.19; H, 4.06; N, 10.98%.
